column5: This is one of the walleyes that I have tangled with and one of the better sunfish that I tied into this spring. Those are size 11 shoes.  I hate posting pictures on this site. Obviously it wouldn't let me put the sunfish up.
Nice fish  Thats the same floor as I have in my boat
That's a huge Sunny. I bet you were surprised when you saw what it was.
Nice eye. That sunny is a biggn.  I remember fishing a lake, Chesley Lake. There were monsters on it.
Thanks for anchoring the site. Nice big sunfish.  Art

Back in the day people from Ohio would come up to Pigeon/Sturgeon lakes and load up on walleyes. Now they come up and load up on bluegill/pumpkinseed which are huge in Tri-Lakes. Sunfish are good scrappers on ultra-light fishing gear. Crappies fight like baby sized wet socks. Fun stuff. Thanks for pics!
Caught the sunfish trolling for walleye.
After catching a bunch of 'gills this spring, I was thinking that if they grew to 3 to 4 pounds ,you would really have your hands full bringing them in !

Nice bluegill! And they ain't just scrappers on light gear, they feel like fighters on anything. Years ago we were fishing the long reef that extends from the bottom of Chiefs Island on Couchiching, and the sunfish there were as big as dinner plates. Every one felt like a smallmouth fight. Ton o' fun!
